meanings.definition: (verb) to branch out like a tree
meanings.sent1: The plant arborized beautifully, spreading its leaves in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The vines in the garden arborized gracefully, creating a natural canopy.
meanings.sent3: I never knew a plant could arborize so wildly, it's like a tree on fast-forward!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas arborized rapidly, connecting and growing like branches in a forest.
meanings.sent5: The roots of the tree arborized deeply into the earth, seeking nourishment.

meanings.sent1: The arborized pattern of the veins in the leaf was intricate and beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The arborized design of the lamp resembled the branches of a tree.
meanings.sent3: The cake had an arborized frosting that looked like a miniature forest.
meanings.sent4: The arborized shadows of the branches danced on the forest floor.
meanings.sent5: The arborized structure of the building gave it a unique and natural appearance.
